tr.ti: Configure and build the package.the configure parts of src_compile have been splitted out in EAPI=2 to src_configure. see

body.codesample: src_compile() { if [ -x ./configure ]; then econf fi if [ -f Makefile ] || [ -f GNUmakefile ] || [ -f makefile ]; then emake || die "emake failed" fi }

body.note: You also need to inherit the flag-o-matic eclass in order to use the append-ldflags function.

body.p: porting the above example to EAPI=2, you won't need to define an extra src_compile, as it only calls emake (which is the default src_compile function).
The following subsections cover different topics which often occur when writing src_compile functions.
